primerIntro:
The gods haven’t walked Draelon in six hundred years. Their temples still stand, their names still carry weight, but none have crossed the Divine Gate since the Silence. The Athumi claim their Lady of Brass remains—the last of them to walk the mortal world—but even that faith feels brittle after centuries of war and decay.

Nations have filled the silence with their own order: Oscana’s feudal lords forge alliances and betrayals in equal measure, Athium’s empire spreads its doctrine through steel and flame, and Eturia hoards magic like coin. Trade and conflict bind them all, yet something stirs beneath the surface—monsters changing in form and mind, storms that howl with voices, and an island called Signika drawing them in like a wound in the world.
primerDetails: Each continent bears scars of wars long past. Oscana’s noble houses feud across verdant plains, while Athium’s iron legions march beneath banners of conquest. Eturia’s mage-lords weave politics like spells, and Letrylor’s jungles whisper with forgotten gods. Yet all eyes now turn north—to Signika—where the world’s wild magic stirs once more.

features.name: Oscana
features.desc:
A stark, grey land of feudal kingdoms, where honour lies as much in the strength of one’s arm as in the quality of one’s tools. Two lords might build a grand metal runeway between their lands to trade goods at great speed—only to aim crank-ballistae at one another the next day for daring to use it.

The Oscanan League has been founded and refounded countless times by kingdoms desperate to defend their homes. With raids from the wildlands beyond Naebolg’s Belt and the growing power of nations across the sea, good craftsmanship and grit remain an Oscanan’s truest companions.

features.name: Athium
features.desc:
The Athumi Empire is the greatest power on Draelon. Expanding for centuries from the holy city of Athumar, disciplined militaries and fervent devotion to their ever-shrouded goddess have fuelled their conquest for over five hundred years. In taming the Viverna Mountains, they claimed dominion over the wyverns, forging skyborne legions to spread their rule from above.

Worship of any divine being other than the Lady of Brass is forbidden. Across the world, it is said there is far more to fear from an Athumi priest than from even their mightiest warrior.

features.name: Eturia
features.desc:
A magocratic republic sprawled across the islands of the Cetryan Ocean, where politics boil down to one thing: talent with magic.

A relatively young power in Draelon—founded only 170 years ago—Eturia has nonetheless secured an impressive foothold on the world stage. Having forged an uneasy alliance with Athium, and with its arcane archives growing larger by the day, ambition has become the nation’s cornerstone.

features.name: Letrylor
features.desc:
A continent swallowed by emerald jungles and overgrown ruins, once home to an entire pantheon of radiant gods. The earth, plants, and beasts still dominate with a wild magic bestowed in the ancient past. 

What settlements dot these lands have learned to grow as one with nature, lead by powerful druids or fearless explorers.

features.name: Arrania
features.desc:
The Scarthold, the Thrice-Burned Lands, Old Arrania — a region whose people struggle to hold on to identity while falling to the mercy of their neighbours. For decades, Athium has used these lands as a place to train and entertain its armies.

The Arranian realms, long weakened by the scars of a ravening war waged when the gods still walked Draelon, are nonetheless home to some of the most prideful folk in the world. Their fierce stubbornness may yet prove enough to keep their enemies at bay.

features.name: Frissia
features.desc:
Once the seat of a world-spanning empire, modern Frissia is a shadow of its former grandeur. Now ruled by two tribes—the Fokari and the Areth—whose mutual hatred has only deepened with time, the island is a land of old scars and stubborn pride. Desperate to prove themselves the rightful heirs to a realm the rest of the world has chosen to forget, they fight over a legacy few still remember.

The people of the island know better. The secrets buried here may yet shape history once more.
